meanings.definition: To give a gift or present to someone, especially at Christmas.
meanings.sent1: I hanseled my sister with a new book for Christmas.
meanings.sent2: Every year, we hanseled our neighbors with homemade cookies.
meanings.sent3: The cat hanseled the mouse with a toy mouse, thinking it was a real one.
meanings.sent4: She hanseled her love with a bouquet of flowers, brightening his day.
meanings.sent5: The children hanseled their teacher with handmade cards full of gratitude.

meanings.definition: To receive a gift or present, especially at Christmas.
meanings.sent1: Last year, I hanseled a beautiful scarf from my aunt.
meanings.sent2: The children hanseled eagerly as they unwrapped their presents.
meanings.sent3: The dog hanseled the treats with excitement, wagging its tail.
meanings.sent4: She hanseled the surprise with joy, feeling grateful for the thoughtfulness.
meanings.sent5: The family hanseled the unexpected visit with warmth and hospitality.
